title: High-Strength Aluminum-Lithium Alloy Design: Machine Learning Utilization Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational materials engineering and data analysis concepts
context.additional_context: Focuses on improving material development efficiency through practical education centered on real-life application examples

learning_goals: Learners can compare the performance differences between RBF and BP neural network models to select a suitable machine learning technique for alloy design.
Learners can predict the composition of aluminum-lithium alloys for target strength with over 80% accuracy using a trained model.
Through project-based assessment, learners can analyze real-world alloy design cases and propose improvement strategies for strength enhancement by over 15%.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
